summary: ShareServe is an instant messaging app with photo and video sharing, AI image and video generation, account creation with custom username/profile number, contacts system, dark theme UI, text effects, and visual polish. Messaging is between in-app accounts only. AI generation follows standard content policies. Authentication uses Apple or Google login instead of Internet Identity.
architectural_notes: Messaging is in-app only; no external SMS or phone network integration
AI generation features must follow standard content policies — no unregulated generation
Authentication uses Apple or Google OAuth — Internet Identity is not used
Web photo/video search results are private — not displayed on user profile, feed, or any shared area
Do not use YouTube as a video source — use alternative platforms (e.g., Pexels, Mixkit, Coverr) for video playback
In-app search should use a real embedded web browser or WebView rather than keyword-mapped placeholder results
Search (photo and video) must be backed by a real browser-based search, not keyword maps or a standalone iframe browser tab
Stories feature must only display real registered users — no fake/placeholder profile names or avatars
known_issues: Account registration is broken and needs to be fixed alongside the auth migration to Apple/Google login
Photos and videos are not displaying in the app (profile feed, chat, or search results)
AI video generator does not show generated videos inline — users cannot tap to watch without saving
Videos in search results or generator appear to be censored/restricted — user wants uncensored video content displayed
Videos and images show a question mark placeholder and are not rendering — layout needs to be fixed
Search page returns random/unrelated photos and videos instead of query-relevant results — search logic is not connected to user input
AI image generator still failing after multiple retry attempts — Pollinations AI image endpoint may be unreachable or returning errors
AI video generator still failing to load video — Pollinations AI video endpoint and Pexels fallback both appear broken
Stories layout was removed or broken in a recent build — must be restored; fake placeholder user names must be removed from stories
Design purchase flow lacks customization — users can buy a design but cannot customize it before purchasing

existing_features.title: Implement in-app messaging between registered users: users can send and receive text messages in one-on-one chat threads. Messages are stored in the backend and retrieved per conversation. Messaging only works between accounts within the app — no external SMS or phone network integration.

Implement photo sharing in chats and on a user profile feed: users can upload photos (stored as base64 or asset URL in the backend), share them in messages, and view shared photos in a gallery-style feed.
Implement video sharing in chats and on a user profile feed: users can upload short videos, share them in messages, and play them inline within the chat or feed view.

Add an AI image generation feature accessible from a dedicated 'Create' tab: users enter a text prompt and receive a generated image they can save to their profile or share in a chat. Generation follows standard content policies.

Add an AI video generation feature on the same 'Create' tab: users enter a text prompt or description and receive a generated short video clip they can save or share. Generation follows standard content policies.

Build the full frontend UI with a dark theme: deep dark backgrounds (near-black), vibrant neon accent colors (e.g., electric violet, cyan, hot pink), glowing UI elements, animated text effects (shimmer, glow, typewriter), gradient highlights, and a sleek futuristic layout. Apply the theme consistently across all screens.

Add a 'Video Facts' section or widget on the home/discovery screen: display a rotating carousel of short informational video cards covering interesting topics (space, science, history, etc.). Videos are static placeholder clips with overlay text facts.
Build a user profile screen showing: profile number, avatar, display name, username, bio, post/photo/video gallery, and a button to edit profile details.

Replace Internet Identity authentication with a username and password based registration and login system. Users register with a unique username, password, display name, and optional bio. Credentials are stored securely in the backend. On login, users provide their username and password to authenticate. Remove all Internet Identity dependencies from the auth flow.

Update the login page UI to display a username and password form instead of the Internet Identity sign-in button. The form should include fields for username and password, a 'Log In' button, and a link to navigate to the registration screen. Apply the existing neon dark theme consistently.

Update the registration page UI to collect username, password, confirm password, display name, and optional bio. On successful registration, automatically log the user in and redirect to the home screen. Apply the existing neon dark theme consistently.

Update the AuthGate component in App.tsx and all hooks that reference Internet Identity (useInternetIdentity, useActor) so that the app's route protection uses the new username/password session state instead of Internet Identity identity. Authenticated routes should only be accessible when the user has a valid session.

Fix the AI image generator so that the generated image reflects the user's actual text prompt. Currently the ImageGenerator component ignores the prompt and returns a random placeholder image. Update the logic so the prompt text meaningfully influences the image selection or displayed result (e.g., use prompt keywords to select a semantically relevant image from a curated set or a prompt-aware URL). The output must visually correspond to what the user typed.

Fix the AI video generator so that the generated video or thumbnail reflects the user's actual text prompt. Currently the VideoGenerator component ignores the prompt and produces random placeholder content. Update the logic so the prompt text meaningfully influences the displayed result (e.g., select a contextually relevant thumbnail or placeholder clip based on prompt keywords). The output must correspond to what the user typed.

Add an in-app web photo search feature. Place it in a new 'Search' tab or dedicated section accessible from the main navigation. Users can type a search query and see a grid of photo results fetched from a public image search API (e.g., Unsplash API or Pexels API using a free-tier key). Results must be displayed privately — they must NOT appear on the user's profile, feed, or be visible to other users. The section is purely for personal browsing within the app.

Add an in-app video search feature in the same Search area as the photo search (e.g., a tab within the Search page). Users can type a search query and see video results fetched from a public video search or embed source (e.g., using YouTube Data API v3 search endpoint or a similar free public API). Videos must be playable inline within the app. Results must be displayed privately — they must NOT appear on the user's profile, feed, or be visible to other users.

Fix photos not displaying anywhere in the app. Photos uploaded to the user's profile feed and shared in chats must render correctly. The PhotoGallery component must properly resolve and display ExternalBlob image data (base64 or URL) in the grid and lightbox views. Debug and correct any data-fetching, URL construction, or rendering issues preventing photos from appearing.

Fix videos not displaying anywhere in the app. Videos uploaded to the user's profile feed and shared in chats must render correctly. The VideoGallery component must properly resolve and display ExternalBlob video data (base64 or URL). Debug and correct any data-fetching, URL construction, or rendering issues preventing videos from appearing on the profile feed and in chat messages.

Update the AI VideoGenerator component so that generated videos (or their prompt-aware thumbnails/clips) can be tapped and watched inline within the Create page — without requiring the user to save or download them first. Display the generated result as an inline playable video player (using a <video> element or an embedded iframe for URL-based sources) directly in the component after generation completes. The save and download actions should remain available but must not be required to view the content.

Add a Settings screen accessible from the main navigation (e.g., a settings icon in the Layout header or a bottom nav entry on mobile). The Settings screen must include toggles for app preferences. At minimum include the following toggles: Dark Mode (on/off), Notifications (on/off), and Autoplay Videos (on/off). Persist toggle state to localStorage so preferences survive page refreshes. Apply the existing neon dark theme consistently to the Settings page.

Rewrite the ImageGenerator component so that the generated image is determined by the user's actual text prompt. Parse the prompt for meaningful keywords (e.g., 'sunset', 'cat', 'city', 'space', 'forest') and map them to a curated set of high-quality, publicly accessible image URLs (e.g., via Unsplash source URLs with explicit topic slugs such as `https://source.unsplash.com/800x600/?{keyword}`). The displayed image must visually correspond to what the user typed. Remove any random or hash-based selection that ignores the prompt content.

Rewrite the VideoGenerator component so that the generated video is determined by the user's actual text prompt. Build a keyword-to-video mapping using a curated set of freely embeddable, publicly accessible, non-restricted video URLs (e.g., from Pexels Videos free API or direct MP4 URLs from public sources). Extract meaningful keywords from the prompt and select the best matching video. The selected video must be displayed inline as a playable `<video>` element (not an iframe) immediately after generation completes — no saving or downloading required to watch it. Remove all random or hash-based selection logic that ignores the prompt.

Replace any currently used video sources in the VideoGenerator component that produce blocked, censored, or unplayable results with alternative direct MP4 video sources that are publicly accessible, embeddable without restrictions, and play without requiring authentication or special permissions. Use Pexels Videos API (free tier) or a curated list of direct public-domain MP4 URLs (e.g., from Pixabay, Coverr, or Mixkit) to ensure videos are uncensored and always playable inline.

Fix the layout of the ImageGenerator component so that generated images are always visible. Replace any broken or question-mark-producing image sources. Use multiple public image platforms as sources (e.g., Unsplash, Picsum, Pexels) so that if one platform fails to load, the component falls back to another. The generated image must always render visibly in the UI — no broken image icons or question mark placeholders.

Fix the layout of the VideoGenerator component so that generated videos always render visibly inline. Replace all YouTube-based video sources with direct MP4 URLs from at least two alternative platforms (e.g., Mixkit and Pexels Videos free-tier direct MP4 links, or Coverr and Pixabay). The generated video must display as a playable <video> element immediately after generation — no question mark placeholders or broken media icons.

Fix the layout of the PhotoGallery component so that all photos (uploaded to profile feed or shared in chats) render visibly. Replace any single-source image URL construction with a multi-platform fallback approach — attempt to load from the stored source first, then fall back to a secondary public image platform (e.g., Picsum Photos) if the primary fails. Ensure the grid and lightbox views both display images correctly with no broken image icons or question marks.

Fix the layout of the VideoGallery component so that all videos (uploaded to profile feed or shared in chats) render visibly as inline playable <video> elements. Remove any YouTube-based source URLs. Use direct MP4 URL sources from at least two alternative platforms (Mixkit, Pexels, Coverr, or Pixabay) as fallback sources. Ensure no broken video icons or question mark placeholders appear in the grid view or in chat messages.

Fix the layout of the SearchPage photo and video tabs so that search results display visibly. For photo search, use multiple image source platforms (e.g., Unsplash source URLs and Picsum as fallback) so results always load. For video search, replace any YouTube-based embed or search results with direct MP4 sources from two alternative platforms (e.g., Pexels Videos API free tier and Mixkit). Ensure all search result thumbnails and videos render without broken icons or question mark placeholders.

Rewrite the SearchPage video search tab so that results are directly driven by the user's search query. When the user submits a query, fetch or select video results that are semantically relevant to the query text — not random or deterministic-but-unrelated placeholders. Use a curated keyword-to-video mapping covering a wide variety of categories (nature, sports, travel, animals, food, technology, music, people, cities, ocean, mountains, cars, space, art, etc.) with at least 40 distinct topic entries. Each topic must map to a direct publicly accessible MP4 URL from Mixkit, Coverr, Pixabay, or Pexels free-tier. When no exact keyword match is found, fall back to a broad 'general' pool of diverse videos rather than a fixed placeholder.

Rewrite the SearchPage photo search tab so that photo results are directly driven by the user's search query. When the user submits a query, construct image URLs using the query text as a keyword via Unsplash source URLs (e.g., `https://source.unsplash.com/400x300/?{query},{index}`) so that displayed photos are visually relevant to what the user typed. Add Picsum as a secondary fallback if Unsplash URLs fail to load. Remove any logic that generates random or query-unrelated photo results.

Replace the existing SearchPage keyword-mapped search with a full in-app web browser experience. Add a dedicated 'Browser' tab or screen accessible from the main navigation. Embed a functional web browsing interface using an <iframe> that allows users to navigate to any URL. Include an address bar where users can type a URL or a search query (queries should be routed through a search engine such as DuckDuckGo or Google via URL, e.g., https://www.google.com/search?q={query}), a Go/Enter button to navigate, and back/forward/refresh controls. The browser content must render inside the app within the iframe. Apply the existing neon dark theme to the browser chrome (address bar, navigation buttons). Browser activity must remain private and must not affect the user's profile, feed, or be visible to other users.

Replace the ImageGenerator component's current keyword-to-Picsum-URL mapping with calls to the Pollinations AI image generation API (https://image.pollinations.ai/prompt/{encoded_prompt}), which is free, requires no API key, and returns a real AI-generated image for any text prompt. When the user submits a prompt, construct the URL as https://image.pollinations.ai/prompt/{encodeURIComponent(prompt)} and display the returned image inline. Show a loading state while the image is being generated. On load error, retry with a slightly modified seed parameter (e.g., append ?seed=2, ?seed=3) up to three times before showing an error message. Remove all keyword mapping, hash-based, and random selection logic. The save and download actions must remain functional using the AI-generated image URL.

Replace the VideoGenerator component's current keyword-to-MP4-URL mapping with calls to the Pollinations AI text-to-video or a suitable free generative video API. As a primary approach, use the Pollinations video generation endpoint if available, or alternatively use the Replicate-hosted open inference endpoint for a free video model accessible without authentication. If no true generative video API is freely available without an API key, implement the following best-effort approach: use the Pexels Videos API (free tier, API key: use a placeholder comment for the developer to insert their key) to fetch a video that is semantically matched to the full prompt text via Pexels search endpoint (https://api.pexels.com/videos/search?query={prompt}&per_page=1), display the first result's SD video file as an inline <video> element. The key requirement is that the result must be driven by the actual prompt text submitted to an external API — not a local keyword map. Remove all local keyword-to-video mapping logic. Display the video as an inline playable <video> element immediately after generation completes. Show a loading state during the API call. Save and share actions must remain available.

Rewrite the ImageGenerator component to use the Pollinations AI image generation API (https://image.pollinations.ai/prompt/{encodeURIComponent(prompt)}?seed={seed}&width=800&height=600&nologo=true) as the primary source. Add a unique random seed per generation attempt. On image load error, automatically retry up to 3 times with different seed values (seed=2, seed=3, seed=4) before displaying a user-facing error message. Show a visible loading spinner/state while the image is being fetched. Remove all local keyword mapping, hash-based, or random selection logic. The displayed image must be the actual Pollinations AI result for the user's prompt. Save-to-profile and download actions must remain functional using the final resolved image URL.

Rewrite the VideoGenerator component to call the Pollinations AI video endpoint (https://video.pollinations.ai/prompt/{encodeURIComponent(prompt)}) as the primary approach. If that endpoint is unavailable or returns an error, fall back to fetching from the Pexels Videos API free tier using the search endpoint (https://api.pexels.com/videos/search?query={encodeURIComponent(prompt)}&per_page=5&orientation=landscape) with API key inserted via environment variable or a clearly marked placeholder constant. Display the first valid result's SD-quality direct MP4 URL in an inline <video> element with controls, autoplay muted. Show a loading spinner during the API call. On error from both sources, display a clear user-facing error message with a retry button. Remove all local keyword-to-video mapping logic. Save and share actions must remain available after a video is loaded.

Rewrite the SearchPage so that both the photo search tab and video search tab are powered by real external API calls driven by the user's actual query text. For photo search: call the Unsplash Source URL pattern (https://source.unsplash.com/400x300/?{encodeURIComponent(query)},{index}) to construct a grid of 12 query-relevant images; add Picsum (https://picsum.photos/seed/{query}-{index}/400/300) as an automatic fallback per image if the Unsplash URL fails to load. For video search: call the Pexels Videos API free tier (https://api.pexels.com/videos/search?query={encodeURIComponent(query)}&per_page=9) using an API key from an environment variable or a clearly marked placeholder; display results as inline playable <video> elements with poster thumbnails; fall back to a curated set of direct public-domain MP4 URLs from Mixkit or Coverr if the API call fails or returns no results. All results must be query-relevant. Remove any random, hash-based, or hardcoded placeholder result logic. Results must remain private (not saved to profile or visible to other users).

Remove the dedicated BrowserPage / 'Browser' tab from the main navigation and from the router entirely. The in-app browser iframe experience is not wanted. Ensure the main navigation only contains the existing core tabs (Home, Contacts, Chat, Profile, Create, Search, Settings). Clean up any routes, nav entries, or imports referencing BrowserPage.

Rewrite the SearchPage to deliver real, broad internet search results for both photo and video tabs. For photo search: use the Unsplash Source URL pattern (https://source.unsplash.com/400x300/?{encodeURIComponent(query)},{index}) as the primary source for a grid of 12 images, with Picsum (https://picsum.photos/seed/{query}-{index}/400/300) as an automatic per-image fallback. For video search: call the Pexels Videos API free tier endpoint (https://api.pexels.com/videos/search?query={encodeURIComponent(query)}&per_page=9&orientation=landscape) using the API key stored in a clearly marked placeholder constant (PEXELS_API_KEY); display each result as an inline playable <video> element with a poster thumbnail; if the Pexels API call fails or returns zero results, fall back to a curated pool of at least 40 keyword-mapped direct MP4 URLs from Mixkit, Coverr, or Pixabay covering diverse categories (nature, sports, travel, animals, food, technology, music, cities, space, etc.). All results must visually correspond to the user's query. Remove all random, hash-based, or hardcoded placeholder logic. Results must remain private — not saved to the user's profile or visible to other users.

Fix the ImageGenerator component so that it reliably produces and displays a real AI-generated image for every prompt. Use the Pollinations AI image generation API (https://image.pollinations.ai/prompt/{encodeURIComponent(prompt)}?seed={seed}&width=800&height=600&nologo=true) as the sole source. Generate a unique random seed on each generation attempt. On image load error (broken src, network error, or HTTP failure), automatically retry up to 3 times using different seed values (seed+1, seed+2, seed+3) before displaying a clear user-facing error message. Show a visible loading spinner while the image is being fetched. The displayed image must be the actual Pollinations AI result for the user's prompt — no keyword mapping, hash-based selection, or random placeholder logic. Save-to-profile and download actions must remain functional using the final resolved image URL.

Fix the VideoGenerator component so that it reliably produces and displays a real AI-generated or API-matched video for every prompt. Primary approach: call the Pollinations AI video endpoint (https://video.pollinations.ai/prompt/{encodeURIComponent(prompt)}) and display the result as an inline <video> element with controls and autoplay muted. If that endpoint returns an error or no playable content within a reasonable timeout (10 seconds), fall back to the Pexels Videos API free tier (https://api.pexels.com/videos/search?query={encodeURIComponent(prompt)}&per_page=5&orientation=landscape) using an API key stored in a clearly marked placeholder constant (PEXELS_API_KEY); display the first valid SD-quality direct MP4 URL as an inline <video> element. Show a loading spinner during all API calls. On failure of both sources, display a clear user-facing error message with a Retry button. Remove all local keyword-to-video mapping logic. Save and Share actions must remain available after a video is loaded.

Completely rewrite the ImageGenerator component to abandon the Pollinations AI endpoint (which is consistently failing) and instead use a multi-source fallback chain: (1) Primary: https://image.pollinations.ai/prompt/{encodeURIComponent(prompt)}?seed={seed}&width=800&height=600&nologo=true — generate a new random seed per attempt; (2) Fallback 1: https://picsum.photos/seed/{encodeURIComponent(prompt)}-{seed}/800/600 — deterministic but prompt-influenced; (3) Fallback 2: construct a URL using the first meaningful keyword extracted from the prompt against https://source.unsplash.com/800x600/?{keyword}. Attempt each source in order when the previous one fails to load (onError). Show a loading spinner during fetching. Only display the final user-facing error 'Could not generate an image — please try a different prompt or try again later.' after all three sources have failed. The Retry/Regenerate button must reset the attempt chain from source 1 with a new seed. Save-to-profile and Download actions must remain functional using the resolved image URL.

Completely rewrite the VideoGenerator component to abandon the Pollinations AI video endpoint and Pexels API (both consistently failing) and instead use a guaranteed-playable curated fallback approach: build a keyword-to-MP4 mapping of at least 50 entries using exclusively direct, publicly accessible MP4 URLs from Mixkit (https://assets.mixkit.co/...) and Coverr (https://coverr.co/...) covering diverse categories (nature, space, ocean, city, animals, food, technology, sports, travel, music, art, people, mountains, cars, science, etc.). Extract the top 3 keywords from the user's prompt and match against the map; if no match, pick from a broad 'general' pool of at least 10 diverse Mixkit/Coverr MP4s. Display the matched video as an inline `<video>` element with controls, autoplay, and muted immediately after generation. Show a loading state while the video source is being resolved. On video element error (canplaythrough failure / src error), automatically try the next best keyword match before showing a user-facing error with a Retry button. Remove all Pollinations and Pexels API call logic. Save and Share actions must remain available after a video loads.

Add a 'Stories' feature on the HomePage: display a horizontally scrollable row of story bubbles at the top of the home screen, above the existing welcome banner and quick-action cards. Each story bubble shows a user avatar (initials-based) and username. Include at least 8 placeholder stories with varied neon-colored avatar rings. Tapping a story bubble opens a full-screen story viewer modal showing a gradient background, the username, a fake 'viewed X hours ago' timestamp, and a close button. Apply the existing neon dark theme consistently.

Add a 'Trending Topics' section on the HomePage below the quick-action cards. Display a list or grid of at least 8 trending topic chips/tags (e.g., '#AI', '#Space', '#Photography', '#Nature', '#Music', '#Sports', '#Travel', '#Technology'). Each chip should have a neon-colored border and a subtle glow effect. Topics are static placeholders. Tapping a topic chip navigates the user to the Search page with the topic pre-filled in the search input.

Add a 'Suggested Users' section on the ContactsPage (or as a widget on the HomePage) showing a list of up to 6 placeholder suggested user cards. Each card displays an initials avatar with a neon-colored ring, a display name, a username, and an 'Add Contact' button. The cards are static placeholder data (hardcoded fake users). The 'Add Contact' button shows a confirmation toast ('Contact request sent!'). Apply the existing neon dark theme consistently.

Add a 'Daily Challenge' widget on the CreatePage, displayed above the existing AI Generate and Upload Media tabs. The widget shows a daily creative prompt (e.g., 'Today's Challenge: Generate an image of a futuristic city at night') with a neon-styled card. Include a 'Use This Prompt' button that pre-fills the AI image generator's prompt input with the challenge text. Rotate through at least 10 different static challenge prompts (cycle daily using the current date modulo the array length). Apply the existing neon dark theme.

Add a notification badge system to the Chat nav item and Contacts nav item. In the Layout component's navigation (both desktop sidebar and mobile bottom nav), display a small neon-colored numeric badge on the Chat icon when there are unread messages, and on the Contacts icon when there are pending contact requests. Derive unread message count from existing message query data and pending requests count from existing contact request query data. If the count is zero, hide the badge. Cap display at '99+' for counts above 99.

Restore the horizontally scrollable Stories row at the top of the HomePage (above the welcome banner and quick-action cards). The Stories row must only display real registered users who have accounts in the app. Do not show any hardcoded, fake, or placeholder user names, avatars, or profiles. If no real users exist or no stories are available, the Stories row should either be hidden or show an empty state — never fake data.

Remove all hardcoded fake/placeholder user entries from the SuggestedUsers component. Suggested user cards must only show real registered users fetched from the backend. If no real users are available to suggest, hide the section or show an empty state message — never display invented names or profiles.

Redesign the design purchase flow so that when a user initiates a purchase of a design, they are first presented with a customization step before completing the purchase. The customization step must allow users to configure relevant options for the selected design (e.g., colors, sizes, text, materials, or other design-specific parameters) before the order is confirmed. The purchase action must not complete until the user has reviewed and confirmed their customization choices. The existing purchase confirmation and payment steps must remain intact and follow the customization step.

Restore the original dark neon theme layout across all pages and components. All screens (Login, Register, Home, Chat, Contacts, Profile, Create, Search, Settings, CustomizeDesign, PurchaseConfirmation) must use deep near-black backgrounds, vibrant neon accent colors (electric violet, cyan, hot pink), glowing UI elements, animated text effects (shimmer, glow, typewriter), gradient highlights, and a sleek futuristic layout. Ensure the CSS custom properties defined in frontend/src/index.css and frontend/index.css for the dark neon design system (cyan, pink, violet, green, yellow accents) are consistently applied. Re-apply the Tailwind dark theme tokens and neon color variables from frontend/tailwind.config.js across all components and pages that may have drifted from the intended dark style.

new_feature_requests.summary: Account creation with custom username and profile number
Dark theme UI with cool visual polish and text effects
In-app messaging between user accounts
Photo sharing between users
Video sharing between users
AI image generation feature (standard content policies)
AI video generation feature (standard content policies)
Contacts system for managing user connections
Video facts and informational content display

Implement backend user account system: users can register with a unique username, auto-generated profile number (e.g., #00123), display name, avatar URL, and bio. Store profiles in stable backend state. Support login via Internet Identity.
Implement a contacts system: users can search for other users by username or profile number, send contact requests, accept or decline requests, and view their contacts list.
Replace Internet Identity login with Apple or Google OAuth authentication for account registration and login

Update the backend to support username/password authentication: add a registerUser function accepting username, password hash, display name, and bio; add a loginUser function accepting username and password that returns a session token or success flag; store user credentials in stable backend state; remove or decouple any Internet Identity principal-based user lookup where it blocks registration and login.
Add in-app web photo search: users can search for photos from the web within the app and view results privately (not visible on their profile or feed)
Add in-app video search: users can search for videos from the web within the app, watch them inline, results are private and not shown on profile or feed
Add a Settings screen with toggles for app preferences
AI video generator should allow users to tap and watch generated videos inline without requiring them to save first

Fix video and image display layout — content shows a question mark and is not visible; switch away from YouTube for videos (use two alternative video platforms/sources); use multiple image platforms for photo display and search
Fix search functionality: search must return results relevant to the user's query, not random photos/videos. Video search should support a wide variety of video categories/topics.
Switch AI image and video generators to use a real AI platform/API that actually generates content from prompts instead of returning keyword-mapped placeholder results
Remove standalone in-app browser; instead connect video search and photo search directly to a browser-backed search so users can search anything freely
Fix AI image and video generators — they are showing errors; switch to different working generator APIs/services that actually produce results
AI image and video generators are still broken/failing after latest build — fix generation so both reliably produce results; also expand the app with additional features/content

Restore the stories/story vibe layout at the top of the home screen — do not remove it. Remove fake placeholder profiles/people names from stories; stories should only show real registered users or be empty if no users exist.
Fix design purchase flow so users can customize what they want before/when buying a design, not just purchase it as-is
